snippet: Mitt Romney still can’t officially claim to be his party’s nominee, which means that the Republican National Committee, which is bound by tradition to remain neutral until a nominee emerges, must wait to begin coordinating with his campaign.
abstract: Mitt Romney still can’t officially claim to be his party’s nominee, which means that the Republican National Committee, which is bound by tradition to remain neutral until a nominee emerges, must wait to begin coordinating with his campaign.

headline.main: For Romney and Republican Committee, a Waiting Game
